definition: to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately

sentences.english: And Trump's governing concept shows a strong inclination toward neo-isolationism.
sentences.chinese: 從其執政理念看，新孤立主義傾向明顯。

sentences.english: But we must reject isolationism and its companion, protectionism. Retreating behind our borders would only invite danger.
sentences.chinese: 但是我們必須拒絕孤立主義及作爲其同伴的保護主義。

sentences.english: The boss has a nasty habit of baiting defenceless subordinates.
sentences.chinese: 這位老闆有一個作弄孤立無助的下級的惡習。

sentences.english: Objective To analyze and explore the diagnosis and surgical treatment of levoversion and isolated levocardia.
sentences.chinese: 分析探討左旋心和孤立左位心的診斷和外科治療。

sentences.english: If it does not do so, it will be further isolated.
sentences.chinese: 如果它不這樣做，將進一步受到孤立。

sentences.english: Part of the problem is that tools in the past have been very compartmentalized and isolated.
sentences.chinese: 部分原因是過去的工具現在已經非常封閉和孤立。

sentences.english: Teenagers experience a feeling of isolation.
sentences.chinese: 青少年飽嘗了一種孤立感。

sentences.english: For an isolated system. You've seen this before, probably.
sentences.chinese: 對孤立系統，大家從前可能見過這個公式。

sentences.english: It shouldn't be something that you study in isolation.
sentences.chinese: 語言不應該是你孤立學習的東西。

sentences.english: That country would soon seek to end its self-imposed diplomatic isolation .
sentences.chinese: 那個國家很快就會設法結束自我實行的外交孤立狀態。

sentences.english: Moral exuberance had inspired both overinvolvement and isolationism.
sentences.chinese: 精神上偏激引起了過多承擔義務和孤立主義。

sentences.english: It would be unwise to consider any of these as existing in isolation.
sentences.chinese: 只是孤立地考慮其中任何一項因素都將是不智之舉。

sentences.english: Still, I shook with a mixture of aloneness and terror.
sentences.chinese: 但是我依舊瑟瑟發抖，因爲我孤立無援，充滿恐懼。

sentences.english: The paleokarst is not developed in vertical zoning and corroded cavity is isolated with poor connectivity.
sentences.chinese: 岩溶發育垂向分帶不明顯，溶蝕孔洞孤立且連通性差。

sentences.english: Time to withdraw into ourselves and start a new era of political and military isolationism.
sentences.chinese: 是向回收縮開始新政治軍事孤立時代的時候了。

sentences.english: But isolating yourself can only worsenthose depressive symptoms.
sentences.chinese: 但是孤立自己只會加重抑鬱症狀。

definition: to crowd out/to push aside/to supplant
to oppose/to set sth against/to be antagonistic to/antithetical/relative opposite/opposing/diametrical
to reject/to exclude/to eliminate/to remove/to repel
hostile/malevolence/antagonism/to view as enemy/to stand against
to adhere/to attach oneself to/to append
to cut apart/to sever/to separate/to isolate
to split up/to divide/to break up/fission/schism
to do things each in one's own way
